messages.subject: ADD
messages.msgSnippet: Here s one that will make you cringe, it does me.  Someone I know has a son, diagnosed with add, who, when he takes his meds, his mother tells me he is very
messages.messageBody:
Here's one that will make you cringe, it does me. Someone I know has
a son, diagnosed with add, who, when he takes his meds, his mother
tells me he is very obedient.
I'm not EVEN going to comment on what I feel like saying to this
woman!
syndi

messages.subject: ADD
messages.msgSnippet: I ve been reading the book Scattered by Gabor Mate.  It is, for me, the best book on ADD that I have ever read.  It describes me, my mom and my 10yo daughter
messages.messageBody:
I've been reading the book "Scattered" by Gabor Mate. It is, for me,
the best book on ADD that I have ever read. It describes me, my mom
and my 10yo daughter perfectly but also talks about how to reprogram
the brain by changing the environment. He feels that the social and
emotional environment plays in the genesis and healing of ADD. .... He
also touches on adoption and quotes a study that found "the rate of
adoption among ADD patients in the clinical population was 8-16 times
the prevalence of adopted children in the population at large." It
has been a very helpful and hopeful book for me.....


Denise in Missouri
Mom to Hanna (10), Emma (6), and Tessa (4)


> He's an addict, but
> other issues like FAS obviously play a part. My family adopted him
> at age 2.
>
